PROGRAM XIII
A NEW YEAR BEGINS
Program:
Our Calendar, what does it tell us?
How do we read it?
References:
Craig: Science for the Elementary School Teacher
St. Louis Science Course of Study for Primary Grades
Equipment:
1. A large wall calendar which everyone can see from his seat
(should contain a complete year)
2. A pointer
Helpers:
One boy and one girl - Father Time, Mother Time
We Get Ready:
No preparation necessary except to have calendar hanging so all can
see it and so our helpers can turn the pages.
After the
Broadcast:
Can you remember the things a calendar tells you?
You could make a calendar that would tell you just lots of things
about the days and weeks. Will you try?
PROGRAM XIV
WHICH WAY?
Program:
Where is North? Where is South?
How can you tell? Will the sun help you?
References:
Craig: Science for the Elementary School Teacher
St. Louis Science Course of Study for Primary Grades
Wonderworld of Science: Book II
Equipment:
A compass (magnetic) - There ought to be several boy or girl scouts
in the upper grades who would lend you a compass for this program if
you do not have one.
Helpers:
One boy and one girl - Mr. Finder, Miss Pointer
Everyone will be in the action.
We Get Ready:
Compass ready and we'll go north, south, east and west.
After the
Broadcast:
When you come to school in the morning where is the sun? If you are
facing the sun in the evening which way are you going? Can you find
directions away from home?
